title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Timothy chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Timothy Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:1, in what should you be strong?
options: The grace that is in Christ Jesus
The power of the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: The grace that is in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:1 instructs to be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: Who should the things heard from Paul be committed to, according to 2 Timothy 2:2?
options: Faithful men who can teach others
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful men who can teach others
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:2 says to commit teachings to faithful men who can teach others also.

questions.question: What example is used in 2 Timothy 2:3 to describe enduring hardship?
options: A good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: A good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 3 compares enduring hardship to being a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:4, what does a soldier not do?
options: Entangle himself with the affairs of this life
questions.correctAnswer: Entangle himself with the affairs of this life
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states a soldier does not entangle himself with worldly affairs.

questions.question: What must a man do to be crowned when striving for mastery, according to 2 Timothy 2:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Strive lawfully
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:5 says a man must strive lawfully to receive the crown.

questions.question: What must the husbandman be first partaker of, according to 2 Timothy 2:6?
questions.correctAnswer: The fruits
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states the husbandman must first be partaker of the fruits.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:8, Jesus Christ was raised from the dead of the seed of whom?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Verse 8 declares Jesus Christ was raised from the dead according to the seed of David.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 2:9 says the word of God is bound.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:9 states the word of God is not bound, even though Paul suffers trouble.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:10, why does Paul endure all things?
options: For the elect's sakes to obtain salvation
questions.correctAnswer: For the elect's sakes to obtain salvation
questions.explanation: Verse 10 says Paul endures all things so the elect may obtain salvation in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Timothy 2:11: 'It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also ______ with him:'
questions.correctAnswer: live
questions.explanation: Verse 11 states that if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:12, what will happen if we deny Him?
questions.correctAnswer: He will also deny us
questions.explanation: Verse 12 clearly states if we deny Him, He will also deny us.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 2:13 says God is unfaithful if we do not believe.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 13 says if we do not believe, He remains faithful because He cannot deny Himself.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:15, what should you study to show yourself approved unto God?
options: Rightly dividing the word of truth
questions.correctAnswer: Rightly dividing the word of truth
questions.explanation: Verse 15 instructs to study to show yourself approved, rightly dividing the word of truth.

questions.question: Who are Hymenaeus and Philetus mentioned in 2 Timothy 2:17?
options: Men who erred concerning the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Men who erred concerning the truth
questions.explanation: Verse 17 and 18 mention Hymenaeus and Philetus as men who erred, teaching false doctrine.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 2:23 advises to avoid foolish and unlearned questions because they cause strife.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 23 warns that foolish questions breed strife and should be avoided.

medium.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Timothy Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is facing hardships and feels weak in faith. Based on 2 Timothy 2, what biblical truth would you share to encourage strength?
options: Be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus
Rely solely on your own strength
Avoid challenges to keep faith intact
Seek help only from human wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:1 encourages believers to be strong through the grace found in Christ Jesus, reminding us that spiritual strength comes from Him, not our own efforts. This is supported by verses 2:3-4, which call for endurance and focus like a good soldier.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 2 teach us about passing on the faith to others?
options: Commit teachings to faithful men who can teach others
Only teach those who agree with you
questions.correctAnswer: Commit teachings to faithful men who can teach others
questions.explanation: Verse 2 instructs Timothy to entrust what he has learned to reliable people who can teach others, emphasizing the importance of faithful transmission of the gospel for continued growth and discipleship.

questions.question: When a believer faces trials, what attitude does 2 Timothy 2:3 suggest they adopt?
options: Endure hardness as a good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Endure hardness as a good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 3 uses the metaphor of a soldier to encourage believers to endure difficulties steadfastly, focusing on their mission and pleasing God, as further explained in verses 4 and 10.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 2:4 say about a believer's focus during their spiritual journey?
options: Do not entangle yourself with worldly affairs to please God
Prioritize worldly success over spiritual matters
Engage fully in social life to witness
questions.correctAnswer: Do not entangle yourself with worldly affairs to please God
questions.explanation: Verse 4 teaches that a believer, like a soldier, should avoid distractions of life’s affairs to stay focused on pleasing God, which is essential for spiritual discipline and growth.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:5, how should a believer strive toward their spiritual goals?
options: Strive lawfully to receive the crown
questions.correctAnswer: Strive lawfully to receive the crown
questions.explanation: Verse 5 emphasizes the importance of pursuing spiritual goals with integrity and according to God’s standards to receive the reward, reinforcing the value of obedience alongside effort.

questions.question: What principle about labor and reward is taught in 2 Timothy 2:6?
options: The hardworking farmer must first partake of the fruits
Labor is unrewarded in this life
Only others enjoy the fruits of labor
questions.correctAnswer: The hardworking farmer must first partake of the fruits
questions.explanation: This verse illustrates that those who labor faithfully deserve to enjoy the benefits of their work, a principle applicable to spiritual and practical Christian living.

questions.question: A believer doubts the resurrection. How does 2 Timothy 2 guide you to address this doubt?
options: Affirm the resurrection of Jesus Christ according to the gospel
Accept that resurrection has already passed
Tell them to decide for themselves
questions.correctAnswer: Affirm the resurrection of Jesus Christ according to the gospel
questions.explanation: Verse 8 reminds believers to remember Jesus Christ was raised from the dead, a foundational truth of the gospel and essential for faith, refuting erroneous teachings mentioned in verses 17-18.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 2:9, Paul's imprisonment hindered the spread of God's word.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states that though Paul suffers imprisonment, the word of God is not bound, showing that God's message continues to spread despite human obstacles.

questions.question: What motivates Paul to endure all things, according to 2 Timothy 2:10?
options: For the sake of the elect to obtain salvation and eternal glory
questions.correctAnswer: For the sake of the elect to obtain salvation and eternal glory
questions.explanation: Verse 10 reveals Paul’s endurance is motivated by love for the elect, desiring their salvation and eternal glory in Christ, showing self-sacrifice for others’ spiritual benefit.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 2:15 advise believers to handle the word of truth?
options: Study to show yourself approved, rightly dividing the word of truth
questions.correctAnswer: Study to show yourself approved, rightly dividing the word of truth
questions.explanation: This verse encourages diligent study and accurate teaching of Scripture, demonstrating the importance of being a responsible and knowledgeable worker for God.

questions.question: What warning does 2 Timothy 2:16 give about certain kinds of talk?
options: Shun profane and vain babblings as they increase ungodliness
Engage in every discussion to prove your point
questions.correctAnswer: Shun profane and vain babblings as they increase ungodliness
questions.explanation: Verse 16 warns believers to avoid meaningless and ungodly talk because it leads to greater ungodliness, emphasizing the need for wise speech.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 2 Timothy 2:19, the foundation of God stands sure, having this seal, 'The Lord knoweth them that are ___."
questions.correctAnswer: his
questions.explanation: Verse 19 states the foundation of God is secure with the seal that 'The Lord knoweth them that are his,' emphasizing God's knowledge and ownership of His people.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:21, what is the result if a person purges themselves from dishonorable things?
options: They become a vessel unto honor, sanctified and fit for good works
questions.correctAnswer: They become a vessel unto honor, sanctified and fit for good works
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that cleansing oneself from dishonor leads to being holy and useful for the Master, prepared for every good work, highlighting sanctification’s role in service.

questions.question: What practical advice does 2 Timothy 2:22 give about dealing with temptation?
options: Flee youthful lusts and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace
Face temptation head-on without avoiding it
questions.correctAnswer: Flee youthful lusts and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace
questions.explanation: Verse 22 advises fleeing youthful lusts and instead following virtues like righteousness and peace, emphasizing active pursuit of godliness to overcome temptation.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 2:24 says a servant of the Lord must be quick to argue to defend the faith.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 24 instructs that the Lord’s servant must not strive but be gentle, patient, and able to teach, promoting humility and peace over argumentation.

hard.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Timothy Chapter 2.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 2:3-4, Paul uses the metaphor of a soldier to describe a Christian's endurance. What is the primary characteristic that the soldier must avoid to please his commander?
options: Entangling himself with the affairs of this life
Taking a reward before the battle
questions.correctAnswer: Entangling himself with the affairs of this life
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:4 explains that no man that warreth entangles himself with the affairs of this life in order to please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier, emphasizing single-minded devotion.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:2, to whom should Timothy commit the teachings he has heard from Paul?
options: Faithful men who can teach others also
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful men who can teach others also
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:2 instructs Timothy to commit Paul's teachings to faithful men who will be able to teach others, establishing a chain of discipleship.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by 'rightly dividing the word of truth' in 2 Timothy 2:15?
options: Handling the Scriptures accurately and rightly applying them
Dividing the Old and New Testaments
questions.correctAnswer: Handling the Scriptures accurately and rightly applying them
questions.explanation: The phrase 'rightly dividing the word of truth' in 2 Timothy 2:15 refers to the diligent and accurate study and application of Scripture, reflecting the Greek term 'orthotomeo' meaning to cut straight or correctly.

questions.question: Which two individuals are mentioned in 2 Timothy 2:17-18 as having erred about the resurrection?
questions.correctAnswer: Hymenaeus and Philetus
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:17-18 names Hymenaeus and Philetus as those who have erred by claiming that the resurrection has already passed, which led to the overthrow of some believers’ faith.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 2:11-13, Paul presents a statement with conditional clauses. Which phrase best captures the theological theme of God's faithfulness despite human unbelief?
options: If we believe not, yet he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.
If we suffer, we shall also reign with him.
If we be dead with him, we shall also live with him.
If we deny him, he also will deny us.
questions.correctAnswer: If we believe not, yet he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:13 shows God's unchanging faithfulness even when believers fail, highlighting the divine attribute that God cannot deny His own nature.

questions.question: What is the 'foundation of God' described in 2 Timothy 2:19, and what seal does it bear?
options: The certainty of God's elect, sealed with 'The Lord knoweth them that are his.'
The Law of Moses, sealed by the Ten Commandments
The temple of Jerusalem, sealed by the priests
The covenant with Abraham, sealed by circumcision
questions.correctAnswer: The certainty of God's elect, sealed with 'The Lord knoweth them that are his.'
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:19 refers to God's foundation as sure and sealed by the knowledge of those who belong to Him, emphasizing divine election and intimate knowledge.

questions.question: Which virtue is NOT listed in 2 Timothy 2:22 as something to pursue alongside righteousness, faith, charity, and peace?
questions.correctAnswer: Humility
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:22 lists righteousness, faith, charity, and peace as virtues to follow, but humility is not explicitly mentioned in this verse.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 2:9 illustrate Paul's understanding of the gospel's power despite his imprisonment?
options: The word of God is not bound even though Paul suffers bonds.
Paul’s chains symbolize the gospel’s failure.
Paul is free to preach without restrictions.
The gospel is only for the free, not prisoners.
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God is not bound even though Paul suffers bonds.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:9 emphasizes that despite Paul's imprisonment and suffering, the gospel message remains free and powerful, unrestrained by physical chains.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 2:24-25, a servant of the Lord should be quick to argue and strive with others.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:24-25 states that the servant of the Lord must not strive but be gentle, patient, and apt to teach, instructing opposing individuals with meekness.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2:20-21, what happens to a man who purges himself from dishonorable vessels?
options: He becomes a vessel unto honor, sanctified, and prepared for every good work.
He is excluded from the great house.
He is given wealth and worldly honor.
He is crowned with a crown of gold.
questions.correctAnswer: He becomes a vessel unto honor, sanctified, and prepared for every good work.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:20-21 teaches that cleansing oneself from dishonorable things leads to being sanctified and fit for the master's use, symbolizing readiness for God's service.

questions.question: The phrase 'study to shew thyself approved unto God' in 2 Timothy 2:15 relates most closely to which Old Testament concept?
options: The diligent seeking of wisdom as seen in Proverbs
The building of the tabernacle in Exodus
The kingship of David in 1 Samuel
questions.correctAnswer: The diligent seeking of wisdom as seen in Proverbs
questions.explanation: The exhortation in 2 Timothy 2:15 parallels Old Testament wisdom literature like Proverbs, which emphasizes diligent study and understanding to live rightly before God.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'resurrection of Jesus Christ of the seed of David' mentioned in 2 Timothy 2:8?
options: It fulfills Old Testament Messianic prophecies about David’s lineage.
It contradicts the teachings of the Pharisees.
It is a metaphor for spiritual awakening only.
It refers to a political uprising in Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfills Old Testament Messianic prophecies about David’s lineage.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:8 highlights Jesus’ resurrection as fulfillment of the Messianic promises that the Savior would come from David’s lineage, connecting New Testament witness with Old Testament prophecy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 2 Timothy 2:6, 'The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the ____.'
questions.correctAnswer: fruits
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:6 uses the image of a husbandman (farmer) who must first partake of the fruits of his labor, symbolizing the reward that comes from diligent work.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give regarding 'profane and vain babblings' in 2 Timothy 2:16-17?
options: They will increase unto more ungodliness and spread like a cancer.
They are harmless and to be ignored.
They bring wisdom to the church.
They are necessary for theological debate.
questions.correctAnswer: They will increase unto more ungodliness and spread like a cancer.
questions.explanation: In 2 Timothy 2:16-17, Paul warns that profane and empty talk leads to greater ungodliness and that such words consume like a canker, damaging faith.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 2:10, Paul endures all things for the sake of the elect so that they may obtain salvation with eternal glory.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:10 clearly states Paul's endurance for the elect's sake to ensure they receive salvation through Christ with eternal glory.

theological.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Timothy Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2, what is the primary source of strength that Timothy is encouraged to rely on?
options: The grace that is in Christ Jesus
The power of the Holy Spirit alone
questions.correctAnswer: The grace that is in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:1 encourages Timothy to be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus. This highlights the sufficiency of divine grace as the believer's strength. This is consistent with 2 Corinthians 12:9 where Paul states, 'My grace is sufficient for thee.' Also, Psalm 84:11 emphasizes God’s grace as a source of strength, and Hebrews 4:16 encourages believers to approach God's throne of grace for help.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Timothy committing the things he heard from Paul to faithful men?
options: So they shall be able to teach others also
questions.correctAnswer: So they shall be able to teach others also
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:2 instructs Timothy to entrust the teachings to faithful men who will be able to teach others. This demonstrates the biblical principle of discipleship and multiplication of sound doctrine, consistent with the Great Commission (Matthew 28:19-20), Titus 2:3-5 on teaching faithful men and women, and 1 Timothy 4:6 regarding good doctrine.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 2, what analogy is used to describe enduring hardships for the gospel?
options: A good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: A good soldier of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:3 uses the analogy of a good soldier of Jesus Christ to illustrate enduring hardship. This metaphor emphasizes discipline, single-mindedness, and commitment consistent with passages like Ephesians 6:10-18 (armor of God), 1 Timothy 1:18 (fight the good fight), and Hebrews 12:1 (endurance in faith).

questions.question: What must a man strive for lawfully to receive a crown, according to 2 Timothy 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Masteries
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:5 teaches that a man who strives for masteries (athletic contests) must do so lawfully to receive a crown. This reflects the biblical principle of integrity and discipline in the Christian life, aligning with 1 Corinthians 9:24-27 on running the race lawfully and Hebrews 12:1-2 regarding perseverance.

questions.question: What does the husbandman who labors expect to be first partaker of, as stated in 2 Timothy 2?
questions.correctAnswer: The fruits
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:6 states that the husbandman (farmer) that labors must be first partaker of the fruits. This indicates the principle of reward for labor, consistent with Galatians 6:7-9 on reaping what one sows, John 4:36 on the joy of harvesters, and Proverbs 14:23 on labor producing profit.

questions.question: What key truth about Jesus Christ does Paul remind Timothy to remember in 2 Timothy 2?
options: Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead
Jesus was a great teacher among men
Jesus was a prophet in Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:8 reminds Timothy of the resurrection of Jesus Christ, born of David’s lineage. This affirms Christ's messianic identity and the historicity of the resurrection, foundational to Christian faith as seen in Romans 1:3-4, Acts 2:29-36, Isaiah 11:1 (Messianic prophecy), and 1 Corinthians 15:3-4.

questions.question: What is Paul’s attitude towards suffering, according to 2 Timothy 2?
options: He endures all things for the elect's sakes
He avoids suffering at all costs
He seeks revenge on his persecutors
questions.correctAnswer: He endures all things for the elect's sakes
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:10 shows Paul’s resolve to endure all sufferings for the sake of the elect, so they may obtain salvation. This mirrors Christ’s example in Hebrews 12:2, Romans 8:35-39 on suffering not separating from God’s love, and 1 Peter 4:12-13 on rejoicing in suffering.

questions.question: Which statement is included in the faithful saying found in 2 Timothy 2?
options: If we be dead with him, we shall also live with him
If we are perfect, we shall reign without suffering
If we judge others, we will be judged
If we build temples, God will bless us
questions.correctAnswer: If we be dead with him, we shall also live with him
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:11 records a faithful saying that if believers die with Christ, they will also live with Him. This corresponds with Romans 6:8, Colossians 3:3-4 on being united with Christ in death and resurrection, and John 11:25 where Jesus declares He is the resurrection and life.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2, what will happen if we deny Christ?
options: We will be forgiven without consequences
We will be exalted in heaven
questions.correctAnswer: He also will deny us
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:12 warns that if we deny Christ, He will deny us. This reflects Jesus’ own teaching in Matthew 10:33, Luke 9:26, and Mark 8:38 about the seriousness of confessing or denying Him before men.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 2 say about God's faithfulness even when we do not believe?
options: He abideth faithful; He cannot deny Himself
questions.correctAnswer: He abideth faithful; He cannot deny Himself
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:13 states that God remains faithful even if we do not believe because He cannot deny Himself. This doctrine is supported by Hebrews 10:23, Numbers 23:19, and Titus 1:2, which affirm God's unchanging faithfulness.

questions.question: What instruction does Paul give concerning disputes about words in 2 Timothy 2?
options: Avoid striving about words to no profit
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid striving about words to no profit
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:14 urges not to strive about words which leads to no profit but subverts hearers. This aligns with Proverbs 17:14, Titus 3:9, and 1 Timothy 6:4-5, which discourage fruitless controversies that cause division.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 2, how should one study to be approved unto God?
options: Rightly dividing the word of truth
questions.correctAnswer: Rightly dividing the word of truth
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:15 encourages study to show oneself approved, a workman who rightly divides the word of truth. This emphasizes diligent, accurate handling of Scripture, consistent with Proverbs 2:1-6, Ezra 7:10, and Acts 17:11 commending diligent study.

questions.question: Who are Hymenaeus and Philetus, mentioned in 2 Timothy 2, and what error are they associated with?
options: They erred saying the resurrection is past already
They denied the existence of God
They claimed Jesus was not the Messiah
They taught salvation by works alone
questions.correctAnswer: They erred saying the resurrection is past already
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:17-18 identifies Hymenaeus and Philetus as those who erred by claiming the resurrection has already happened, thus overthrowing the faith of some. This false teaching contrasts with the apostolic proclamation of a future bodily resurrection (Acts 24:15, 1 Corinthians 15:20-23, John 5:28-29).

questions.question: What is the foundation of God described as in 2 Timothy 2?
options: Sure, sealed with the knowledge that the Lord knows those who are His
questions.correctAnswer: Sure, sealed with the knowledge that the Lord knows those who are His
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:19 affirms the foundation of God stands sure, sealed with the truth that the Lord knows those who belong to Him. This is consistent with 1 Corinthians 3:11 on Christ as the foundation, Isaiah 28:16 on the sure foundation, and Psalm 139:1-4 on God’s intimate knowledge of His people.

questions.question: What qualities does Paul urge Timothy to follow in 2 Timothy 2 to avoid youthful lusts?
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness, faith, charity, peace
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 2:22 exhorts fleeing youthful lusts and pursuing righteousness, faith, charity, and peace. This aligns with Galatians 5:22-23 (fruit of the Spirit), Romans 14:17, and Philippians 4:8 emphasizing godly virtues.
